All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Runnable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants
public class TreeFrame
extends JWFrame

Class to display a tree graphically as a tree map and link node tree.

Version:
3.2.1, 3rd April, 2014.
Author:
Jo Wood, giCentre.
See Also:
Serialized Form

Constructor Detail

TreeFrame

public TreeFrame(TreeMappa treeMappa)
Initialises the window for displaying a hierarchical set of data. If the tree object is provided, a conventional cascading tree representation will be included in the window along with the treemap. If not, only the treemap is displayed.

Parameters:
treeMappa - Object representing the treemap.
Method Detail

writeImage

public boolean writeImage(java.lang.String imgFileName)
Writes the tree map display to an image or SVG file with the given name.

Parameters:
imgFileName - Name of image file to write.
Returns:
True if file written successfully.

getTreeMapPanel

public TreeMapPanel getTreeMapPanel()
Provides the panel in which the treemap is displayed.

Returns:
Panel in which the treemap is displayed.
